fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.fs

Interface IFileSystemDriver


  • public interface IFileSystemDriver
    Represents a virtual filesystem for accessing resources on the ViewShell server. One virtual filesystem may contain other filesystems.

    Filesystems are accessed using paths (created with IFileSystemService.getPath(String, IFileSystemDriver)), and implementations of this interface act as drivers (providing all functionality required by the filesystem service).

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access to state information. There is no expectation for exclusive locking for accessing file contents.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IFileSystemView

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        IPath getRoot()
        Gets the root path. Within this filesystem, this can be represented by "/".
        Returns:
        the root path, never null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • as

        <T> T as(IPath path,
         Class<T> asType)
        Gets the specified path as an object of the specified type. Drivers are not required to support arbitrary conversions.
        Type Parameters:
        T - class type for the desired conversion.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to be retrieved as an object.
        asType - desired class type.
        Returns:
        the path as an object of the specified type, if the conversion is possible, otherwise null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • is

        <T> boolean is(IPath path,
               Class<T> ofType)
        Determines if the specified path can be converted to an object of the specified type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - class type for the desired conversion.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to be retrieved as an object.
        ofType - desired class type.
        Returns:
        true if calling as(IPath, Class) with identical parameters should yield a non-null object of the required type. In all other cases, this must return false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • list

        List<IPath> list(IPath path)
        Lists child directory paths for the specified parent path. The parent path can be a folder or a filesystem.
        Parameters:
        path - the non-null parent path.
        Returns:
        a list of child paths, if any, or an empty list.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if the path is null or invalid.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isHidden

        boolean isHidden(IPath path)
        Determines if the path represents a hidden file or folder.

        Hidden files are accessible using this API, but should not be made available to users (for example, a template source file should not be made available, whereas stylesheets should be made available, unless stylesheets are applied server-side).

        In some cases, it may be possible to determine if a path is hidden with requiring that the element identified by the path exists (for example, when visibility is determined by the file's name or extension).

        Parameters:
        path - the path to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        true if the path represents a hidden item that should not be made available to an end-user, or false in all other cases.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isFile

        boolean isFile(IPath path)
        Determines if the specified path exists and is a file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        true if the path exists and is a file, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isFolder(IPath), isFileSystem(IPath)

      • isFolder

        boolean isFolder(IPath path)
        Determines if the specified path exists and is a folder.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        true if the path exists and is a folder, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isFile(IPath), isFileSystem(IPath)

      • createFolder

        IPath createFolder(IPath path)
            throws FileSystemException
        Creates a folder for the specified path, if the path can represent a folder. If any parent folders are missing, then a non-atomic attempt will be made to create them first.

        Invoking this method does nothing if the path already represents a folder.

        Parameters:
        path - the path of the folder to create.
        Returns:
        the supplied path, for method call chaining.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if this path already exists and is not a folder, or if this driver cannot create a folder using this path.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isFileSystem

        boolean isFileSystem(IPath path)
        Determines if the specified path exists and is an embedded filesystem. Note that if the path is the root, then this will return false (as not embedded and to help avoid recursion errors).
        Parameters:
        path - the path to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        true if the path exists and is an embedded filesystem, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isWatchable

        boolean isWatchable(IPath path)
        Determines if the specified path is a watchable file or folder. This is not required to be supported for all directories of all implementations of a filesystem.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to be watched for changes (file or folder).
        Returns:
        true if the path can be watched, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getWatcher(IPath)

      • getWatcher

        IFileWatcher getWatcher(IPath path)
        Gets a watcher for changes to a specific file path or under a specific folder path. This is not required to be supported for all paths of all implementations of a filesystem. The filesystem may cache and share watchers for paths, exclusive access should not be assumed.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to be watched.
        Returns:
        the watcher.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if a watcher could not be created.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IFileWatcher.isWatching(), IFileWatcher.startWatching(), IFileWatcher.stopWatching(), isWatchable(IPath)

      • isReadable

        boolean isReadable(IPath path)
        Determines whether the specified path is known to be readable.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to evaluate.
        Returns:
        true if the path exists and is known to be readable, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isWriteable

        boolean isWriteable(IPath path)
        Determines whether the specified path is known to be writeable.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to evaluate.
        Returns:
        true if the path exists and is known to be writeable, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getLastModified

        long getLastModified(IPath path)
        Gets the time of the last modification for the path. For directories, this applies to the directory itself and not necessarily its contents.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to evaluate.
        Returns:
        time of the last modification (milliseconds since Unix epoch), or 0 if unknown or unavailable.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFileSize

        long getFileSize(IPath path)
        Gets the size of the file, if this path represents a file and if the size can be efficiently determined. For directories and embedded filesystems, this is not relevant and must therefore always return -1.

        When it is not efficient to determine this, then the driver can return a file size of -1. Efficiency means that calculating the file size is a cheap operation, such as reading a file size from a disk-based filesystem (whereas accessing a file in a database may be considered costly).

        Parameters:
        path - the path to evaluate.
        Returns:
        the file size (as a number of bytes), if it can be efficiently determined. In all other cases, returns -1.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFileCharset

        Charset getFileCharset(IPath path)
        Gets the character encoding of the file, if this path represents a text file and if the encoding can be determined. For directories and embedded filesystems, this is not relevant and must therefore always return null.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to evaluate.
        Returns:
        the character encoding, if relevant and if it can be determined. In all other cases, this returns null.

      • getInputStream

        InputStream getInputStream(IPath path)
                    throws IOException
        Gets an input stream to read the contents of the file with the specified path. This can work with from files in embedded filesystems.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to read.
        Returns:
        the stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an input stream cannot be obtained.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPath.getReader()

      • getOutputStream

        OutputStream getOutputStream(IPath path)
                      throws IOException
        Gets an output stream to write the contents of the file with the specified path. This can work with from files in embedded filesystems. If the file does not exist, this should where possible automatically create it.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to write.
        Returns:
        the stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an output stream cannot be obtained.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPath.getWriter()
